intro: Aspalathus arenaria, commonly known as the Cape daisy, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It is characterized by its small, daisy-like yellow flowers and hairy, narrow leaves. The plant thrives in sandy or rocky soils and is often found in coastal areas. It is a low-growing shrub that produces small, round fruits containing seeds. Aspalathus arenaria is well adapted to arid conditions and is drought-tolerant.
